overview: Valuation for statutory purposes including rating. Examination of all taxes affecting property, including land tax. Compulsory acquisition and compensation.
ilo: Demonstrate a sound understanding of taxation affecting property;
Be involved in a moot court.

Prerequisites.content: Admission into one of the following:

content: Admission into or selection of one of the following:200pt Program course entry point in the MC-PROP Master of PropertyAdmission into or selection of one of the following:MC-PROP2Y Master of Property702PA Graduate Diploma in Property ValuationMC-PROPUP Master of Property/Master of Urban Planning
200pt Program course entry point in the MC-PROP Master of Property
MC-PROPUP Master of Property/Master of Urban Planning
Admission into MC-CMPROP( Master of Construction / Master of Property)  OR Admission into MC-ARCPROP (Master of Architecture / Master of PROP) with an undergraduate major or degree in Property
200pt Program course entry point in the MC-PROP Master of Property
MC-PROPUP Master of Property/Master of Urban Planning

Prerequisites.content: All ofCodeNameTeaching periodCredit PointsABPL90274Property Markets and ValuationsSemester 1 (On Campus - Parkville)12.5ABPL90275Property Resources and ManagementSemester 2 (Dual-Delivery - Parkville)12.5

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Assignment 1 - Multiple Regression Analysis estimating the value of 6,000 properties. Excel worksheet & Word report required to be submitted
Assignment 2 - A full professional standard compensation valuation report

Mock Court Room Presentation - the student will be required to act as both an expert witness and also as a cross examiner based on the findings of Assignment 2 - compensation valuation, equivalent to 500 words per student
assessment.hurdle: Students must satisfactory complete the Mock Court Room Presentation

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours: 1 x 2 hours of lectures per week; 1 x 1 hour studio per week.
